title: Second Round of Blackouts Begins in California, With More on Horizon
text:
SAN FRANCISCO—PG&E Corp. on Wednesday began shutting off power to 179,000 customers in 17 California counties, its second major intentional blackout this month meant to head off potential wildfires.

The shut-offs began at 2 p.m. local time in the Sierra Nevada foothills and 3 p.m. in some counties north of San Francisco. More were planned for 1 a.m. Thursday in parts of San Mateo County, between San Francisco and San Jose, and Kern County, in the southern part of the state’s Central Valley.

...
description: PG&E said it would begin shutting off power to 179,000 customers in 17 counties, its second major intentional blackout this month meant to head off wildfires.
